author: Source staff
title: Saturday Will Be Sunny, 84°F
text:
Updated 12/29/23 at 7:56 p.m. AST
VI SOURCE WEATHER UPDATES
Series: “Extreme Weather in the Caribbean”
- Part 1:
Caribbean Earthquakes and Tsunamis
- Part 2:
Caribbean Volcanoes
- Part 3:
Rip Currents
- Part 4:
Hurricanes
- Part 5:
Wildfires
- Part 6:
Flash Floods
SATURDAY’S FORECAST: 12/30/23
Happy Holidays, and Happy Saturday!
According to the
National Weather Service in San Juan, Puerto Rico, Saturday will be a sunny day, primarily due to a ridge of high pressure over the region. The high temperature will be approximately 84°F, 28.8°C, with winds out of the east-northeast at about 11 mph. There will only be a very slight chance of a passing shower.
Saturday night will be partly cloudy, with a chance of scattered showers throughout the night. The low temperature will be approximately 75°F, 23.8°C, with winds out of the east-northeast at about 10 to 13 mph. The possibility of rain on Saturday night is about 30%.
Below: Infrared satellite imagery obtained at 7:20 p.m. AST on Friday indicates mostly clear-to-partly cloudy skies around the USVI and Puerto Rico.
MARINE WEATHER FORECAST
On Saturday, seas will be approximately 1 to 3 feet, with a swell period of 10 seconds. Winds will be out of the east-northeast at about 5 to 10 knots.
On Saturday night, seas will be approximately 2 to 4 feet, occasional seas up to 5 feet, and with a swell period of 10 seconds. Winds will be out of the east-northeast at about 10 to 15 knots.
The water temperature is approximately 81-82°F, 27°C.
Ocean Water Temperature Map on 12/29/23, courtesy of NOAA:
Wave Height Forecast Map courtesy of NWS:
HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS
Rip Currents: The rip current risk is expected to be moderate across most of the region on Saturday.
Clear = Low Rip Current Risk
Yellow = Moderate Rip Current Risk
Red = High Rip Current Risk
Learn more about rip current safety in an interview between the NWS and the VI Source
here.
TROPIC WATCH
Tropical Activity: The
National Hurricane Center (NHC) does not expect any cyclonic development. November 30 was the last day of the 2023 Atlantic Hurricane Season! Please read a review of the season https://stthomassource.com/content/2023/11/29/colorado-state-university-reports-above-normal-2023-atlantic-hurricane-season-in-post-season-review/. Click here to learn tips on being prepared for hurricane season in 2024.
OBSERVATIONS
Sunrise: 6:51 a.m.
Sunset: 5:53 p.m.
Ocean water temperature: Approximately 81-82°F, 27°C.
UV index: 6 out of 10 (MODERATE-HIGH)
Friday’s high temperature: 83°F, 28.3°C
Friday’s low temperature: 74°F, 23.3°C
Preparation for extreme weather events in the Caribbean, such as earthquakes and tropical cyclones, is important. Residents and visitors in the USVI are encouraged to stay updated on weather events on the
V.I. Source Weather page and sign up for alerts from the National Weather Service and the Virgin Islands Territorial Emergency Management Agency.
